page.title: 06INDUSTRY- BRITISH STEEL
page.content: British steel Lackenby works just comes within the area to the south of the Tees in the south east of the 15 square km block. Lackenby works produces mainly pipes, rods and rolled steel.The methods are the Basic Oxygen Process (using imported ore) and the Electric Arc Process (using scrap).This is an integrated steelworks. Iron ore plus scrap, coke and limestone enter the works. Finished rods, pipes and sheets leave. They are then used in other industries, mainly in the Midlands. Iron ore comes from Sweden and Venezuela and isimported to Teesside. Coke is from coking coal, mainly from the Durham field. Limestone is the Magnesian limestone, which outcrops to the north of the area between Hartlepool and Sunderland.
